docs.text: Welcome This module contains a collection of general utility functions for PowerShell, Azure, Azure DevOps and Slack. See below for some scenarios On Windows get Azure DevOps credentials (PAT) from Git repo $credential = Get-AzureDevOpsCredential -Url 'https://!company!@dev.azure.com/!company!' Register Azure DevOps private Artifacts Feed (package-source) & import modules from this Artifacts Feed Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource -Name 'MyCustomFeedName' -Url 'https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/!company!/_packaging/!feedname!/nuget/v2' -Credential $credential Import-AzureDevOpsModules -PackageSource 'MyCustomFeedName' -Modules @( 'module1' , 'module2' ) -Credential $credential -Latest Register Azure DevOps private Artifacts Feed (package-source) & import modules from this Artifacts Feed Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource -Name 'MyCustomFeedName' -Url 'https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/!company!/_packaging/!feedname!/nuget/v2' -Credential $credential Import-AzureDevOpsModules -PackageSource 'MyCustomFeedName' -Modules @( 'module1' , 'module2' ) -Credential $credential -Latest Publish Package to private Azure DevOps Artifacts Feed Publish-PackageToAzureDevOps -ModuleName 'MyModule' -ModulePath './Output' -Feedname 'MyCustomFeedName' -FeedUrl 'https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/!company!/_packaging/!feedname!/nuget/v2' -AccessToken 'sasasasa' Get Secrets from Azure Keyvault $Tokens = @{} Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault -Vault 'MyVaultName' -Tokens $Tokens -SubscriptionId 'mySubscriptionId' Send message to Slack See here
docs.title: Welcome

docs.text: This module contains a collection of general utility functions for PowerShell, Azure, Azure DevOps and Slack. See below for some scenarios
docs.title: Welcome

docs.text: $credential = Get-AzureDevOpsCredential -Url 'https://!company!@dev.azure.com/!company!'
docs.title: On Windows get Azure DevOps credentials (PAT) from Git repo

docs.text: Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource -Name 'MyCustomFeedName' -Url 'https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/!company!/_packaging/!feedname!/nuget/v2' -Credential $credential Import-AzureDevOpsModules -PackageSource 'MyCustomFeedName' -Modules @( 'module1' , 'module2' ) -Credential $credential -Latest
docs.title: Register Azure DevOps private Artifacts Feed (package-source) & import modules from this Artifacts Feed

docs.text: Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource -Name 'MyCustomFeedName' -Url 'https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/!company!/_packaging/!feedname!/nuget/v2' -Credential $credential Import-AzureDevOpsModules -PackageSource 'MyCustomFeedName' -Modules @( 'module1' , 'module2' ) -Credential $credential -Latest
docs.title: Register Azure DevOps private Artifacts Feed (package-source) & import modules from this Artifacts Feed

docs.text: Publish-PackageToAzureDevOps -ModuleName 'MyModule' -ModulePath './Output' -Feedname 'MyCustomFeedName' -FeedUrl 'https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/!company!/_packaging/!feedname!/nuget/v2' -AccessToken 'sasasasa'
docs.title: Publish Package to private Azure DevOps Artifacts Feed

docs.text: $Tokens = @{} Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault -Vault 'MyVaultName' -Tokens $Tokens -SubscriptionId 'mySubscriptionId'
docs.title: Get Secrets from Azure Keyvault

docs.text: See here
docs.title: Send message to Slack

docs.text: Release Notes [0.1.15] ### Added - Added Service HealthCheck settings from Config - Added tests results to Azure Pipeline [0.1.14] ### Added - Added Module and Application settings from Config - Added multiple module files support to Config ### Changed ### Fixed [0.1.12] ### Added - Added secrets support to Convert-TokensInFile ### Changed ### Fixed [0.1.11] ### Added - Added Send-ToSlack - Added tests (work in progress) - Added docs (work in progress) - Added code signing ### Changed ### Fixed [0.1.10] ### Added ### Changed - Renamed psake files to build.ps1 and build.psake.ps1 ### Fixed - Fix Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource url check ps 5.1 [0.1.9] ### Added - Added Pester tests tokens/config - Added token service cert-hash and current machine name support ### Changed ### Fixed [0.1.8] ### Added - Added install/import module Az.KeyVault - Added support for disabled keyvault secrets ### Changed ### Fixed - Fixed loginfo issue Convert-TokensInFile [0.1.7] ### Added - Added force switch to Connect-ToAzure ### Changed - Renamed Select-AzureSubscription to Select-AzureDefaultSubscription - Renamed Initialize-Azure to Initialize-AzureModules ### Fixed [0.1.5] ### Added - Added Initialize-Azure, Test-AzureConnected, Assert-AzureConnected, Connect-ToAzure and Select-AzureSubscription - Added parameter validation to all functions ### Changed - Refactored handling account/logged-in user to Azure in Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault ### Fixed [0.1.4] ### Added ### Changed - Updated Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault with more diagnostics and preventing issue connecting Azure when running in Azure DevOps ### Fixed [0.1.3] ### Added - Added access check to Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource - Added force install Az modules in Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault ### Changed ### Fixed [0.1.2] ### Added - Added Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault, Add-TokensFromConfig and Convert-TokensInFile ### Changed ### Fixed [0.1.1] ### Added - Initial version ### Changed ### Fixed The format is based on Keep a Changelog
docs.title: Release Notes

docs.text: ### Added - Added Service HealthCheck settings from Config - Added tests results to Azure Pipeline
### Added - Added Module and Application settings from Config - Added multiple module files support to Config ### Changed ### Fixed
### Added - Added secrets support to Convert-TokensInFile ### Changed ### Fixed
### Added - Added Send-ToSlack - Added tests (work in progress) - Added docs (work in progress) - Added code signing ### Changed ### Fixed
### Added ### Changed - Renamed psake files to build.ps1 and build.psake.ps1 ### Fixed - Fix Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource url check ps 5.1
### Added - Added Pester tests tokens/config - Added token service cert-hash and current machine name support ### Changed ### Fixed
### Added - Added install/import module Az.KeyVault - Added support for disabled keyvault secrets ### Changed ### Fixed - Fixed loginfo issue Convert-TokensInFile
### Added - Added force switch to Connect-ToAzure ### Changed - Renamed Select-AzureSubscription to Select-AzureDefaultSubscription - Renamed Initialize-Azure to Initialize-AzureModules ### Fixed

### Added - Added Initialize-Azure, Test-AzureConnected, Assert-AzureConnected, Connect-ToAzure and Select-AzureSubscription - Added parameter validation to all functions ### Changed - Refactored handling account/logged-in user to Azure in Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault ### Fixed

### Added - Added access check to Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource - Added force install Az modules in Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault ### Changed ### Fixed
### Added - Added Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault, Add-TokensFromConfig and Convert-TokensInFile ### Changed ### Fixed
### Added - Initial version ### Changed ### Fixed The format is based on Keep a Changelog

Get-AzureDevOpsAccessToken SYNOPSIS Get the Azure DevOps Personal Access Token from Azure Devops Hosted Agent (In build/deploy) or the Windows Credential Store SYNTAX Get-AzureDevOpsAccessToken [-Url] <Object> [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Get the Azure DevOps Personal Access Token from Azure Devops Hosted Agent (In build/deploy) or the Windows Credential Store. This function is MS Windows only when running local. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 $token = Get-AzureDevOpsAccessToken 'https://mycompany@dev.azure.com/mycompany') PARAMETERS -Url Url of the Azure DevOps subscription like https://(mycompany)@dev.azure.com/(mycompany) Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES RELATED LINKS

docs.text: Import-AzureDevOpsModules SYNOPSIS Import PowerShell module(s) and if not found install them from Azure DevOps Artifacts SYNTAX Import-AzureDevOpsModules [-PackageSource] <Object> [-Modules] <Object> [[-Credential] <PSCredential>] [-Latest] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Import PowerShell module(s) and if not found install them from Azure DevOps Artifacts EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource -Name myFeed -Url https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/myCompany/_packaging/myFeed/nuget/v2 Import-AzureDevOpsModules -PackageSource 'myFeed' -Modules @('myModule') -Latest PARAMETERS -PackageSource Azure DevOps packagesource name Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Modules Array of modules to import Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 2 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Credential Credentials to access feed Type : PSCredential Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 3 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Latest Always import latest modules Type : SwitchParameter Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : Named Default value : False Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES RELATED LINKS

docs.text: Publish-PackageToAzureDevOps SYNOPSIS Publish the PowerShell Package to the Azure Devops Feed / Artifacts SYNTAX Publish-PackageToAzureDevOps [-ModuleName] <Object> [[-ModulePath] <Object>] [-Feedname] <Object> [-FeedUrl] <Object> [-AccessToken] <Object> [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Publish the PowerShell Package to the Azure Devops Feed / Artifacts. Depends on nuget.exe installed and in environment path. Strategy: - Register feed with nuget - Register local temp feed to use Powershell Publish-Module command - Publish locally created module to feed with nuget.exe EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Publish-PackageToAzureDevOps -ModuleName 'MyModule' -ModulePath './Output' -Feedname 'MyFeed' -FeedUrl 'https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/mycompany/_packaging/MyFeed/nuget/v2' -AccessToken 'sasasasa' PARAMETERS -ModuleName Name of the PowerShell Module to publish Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -ModulePath Root path of the module Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 2 Default value : ./Output Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Feedname Name of the Azure DevOps feed Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 3 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -FeedUrl Url of the Azure DevOps feed Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 4 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -AccessToken Personal AccessToken used for Azure DevOps Feed push/publish Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 5 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES RELATED LINKS
docs.title: Publish-PackageToAzureDevOps

docs.text: Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource SYNOPSIS Registers a package source from AzureDevOps Feed / Artifacts SYNTAX Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource [-Name] <Object> [-Url] <Object> [[-Credential] <PSCredential>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Registers a package source from AzureDevOps Feed /Artifacts. If already found removes reference first. EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Register-AzureDevOpsPackageSource -Name myFeed -Url https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/myCompany/_packaging/myFeed/nuget/v2 PARAMETERS -Name Name of package source Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Url Url of package feed Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 2 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Credential Credentials to access feed Type : PSCredential Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 3 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES RELATED LINKS

docs.text: Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault SYNOPSIS Get Azure Keyvault secrets and add them to token collection SYNTAX Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault [-Vault] <Object> [-Tokens] <Object> [[-SubscriptionId] <Object>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Get secrets from Azure Keyvault and add them to token collection, use default logged-in account to Azure or try to get it from 'az cli' EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 $Tokens = @{} Add-TokensFromAzureKeyVault -Vault 'MyVaultName' -Tokens $Tokens -SubscriptionId 'mySubscriptionId' PARAMETERS -Vault Name of the Azure KeyVault Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Tokens Hashtable to add secrets to Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 2 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -SubscriptionId Azure Subscription ID Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 3 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES RELATED LINKS

docs.text: Add-TokensFromConfig SYNOPSIS Get tokens from config repository and add them to token collection SYNTAX Add-TokensFromConfig [-ConfigPath] <Object> [-Tokens] <Object> [-Env] <Object> [[-Module] <Object>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Get tokens from xml config repository and add them to token collection EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 $Tokens = @{} Add-TokensFromConfig -ConfigPath "$PSScriptRoot/config" -Tokens $Tokens -Env 'local' PARAMETERS -ConfigPath Root path of the xml config files Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Tokens Hashtable to add tokens to Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 2 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Env Token environment filter, filter the tokens by environent like local, develop, test etc... Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 3 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Module {{ Fill Module Description }} Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 4 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES RELATED LINKS

docs.text: Convert-TokensInFile SYNOPSIS Convert the tokens in file to their actual values SYNTAX Convert-TokensInFile [-FileName] <Object> [[-PrefixToken] <Object>] [[-SuffixToken] <Object>] [[-DestFileName] <Object>] [-ShowTokensUsed] [-SecondPass] [[-Tokens] <Object>] [<CommonParameters>] DESCRIPTION Convert the tokens in file to their actual values EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 $Tokens = @{} Add-TokensFromConfig -ConfigPath "$PSScriptRoot/config" -Tokens $Tokens -Env 'local' Get-ChildItem .\$ConfigLocation*.* | ForEach-Object { $destFile = Join-Path $ArtifactsLocation $ .Name Convert-TokensInFile -FileName $ .Fullname -DestFileName $destFile -Tokens $Tokens } PARAMETERS -FileName Name of the file to convert Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : True Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -PrefixToken Token prefix Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 2 Default value : __ Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -SuffixToken Token suffix Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 3 Default value : __ Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -DestFileName File name of converted file Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 4 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -ShowTokensUsed Switch to echo tokens replaced Type : SwitchParameter Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : Named Default value : False Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -SecondPass Switch to signal that same file is used in multiple conversions Type : SwitchParameter Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : Named Default value : False Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Tokens Hashtable to add tokens to Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 5 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False CommonParameters This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters . INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES RELATED LINKS

docs.text: Send-ToSlack SYNOPSIS Send a msg to Slack Channel SYNTAX Send-ToSlack [[-Msg] <Object>] [[-Channel] <Object>] [[-Username] <Object>] [[-IconUrl] <Object>] [[-Emoji] <Object>] [-AsUser] [[-Token] <Object>] [[-Attachments] <Object>] DESCRIPTION Send a msg to Slack Channel via the Incoming Webhook integration App. See in slack: Browse Apps / Custom Integrations / Incoming WebHook or see notes below EXAMPLES EXAMPLE 1 Send-ToSlack -m 'Hello' -c 'TestChannel' -u 'me' -e ':bomb:' -t 'mytoken...' PARAMETERS -Msg The message to send Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : m Required : False Position : 1 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Channel The Channel to send to Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : c Required : False Position : 2 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Username The user of the message Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : u Required : False Position : 3 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -IconUrl The url of the icon to display in the message, otherwise use emoji Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : iu Required : False Position : 4 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Emoji The emoji to use like ':ghost:' or ':bom:' see slack documentation for more Emoji. Use IconUrl for custom emoji Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : e Required : False Position : 5 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -AsUser Send msg as this User Type : SwitchParameter Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : a Required : False Position : Named Default value : False Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Token The Incoming WebHook Token Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : t Required : False Position : 6 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False -Attachments {{ Fill Attachments Description }} Type : Object Parameter Sets : (All) Aliases : Required : False Position : 7 Default value : None Accept pipeline input : False Accept wildcard characters : False INPUTS OUTPUTS NOTES for documentation about configuring Slack/Aquire token see https://api.slack.com/messaging/webhooks or https://api.slack.com/legacy/custom-integrations RELATED LINKS
docs.title: Send-ToSlack
